citeinfo.origin: Chinese Academy of Fishery Sciences, Yellow Sea Fisheries Research Institute
citeinfo.title: Time-series Information in the Yellow Sea and Bohai Sea

descript.abstract:
Time-series data collected by the Yellow Sea Fisheries Research Institute (YSFRI) mainly focused on the Yellow Sea and Bohai Sea. The surveys were conducted only by bottom trawl at different years since the mid-1980s. The stations of bottom trawl surveys were all predetermined. The data include temperature, salinity, nutrients, plankton, invertebrate, species composition of trawl, length, weight, stomach contents of fish, etc. The hydroacoustic/trawl surveys have been used to assess the stock biomass in the Yellow Sea and sometimes in the East China Sea, for such species as Japanese anchovy (Engraulis japonicus), largehead hairtail (Trichiurus haumela) and sardine (Sardinops melanosticta). During the stock assessment surveys, environmental parameters were also collected at the same time. Those parameters are useful for studying ecosystem changes and may influence the ecosystem and biodiversity in the sea.
[ Reference: PICES Scientific Report No. 18 2001, Proceedings of the PICES/CoML/IPRC Workshop on "Impact of Climate Variability on Observation and Prediction of Ecosystem and Biodiversity Changes in the North Pacific", http://www.pices.int/publications/scientific_reports/Report18/default.aspx. ]
descript.purpose: To assess relative abundance and shift of dominant species.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
